results.title: The Water must go somewhere
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. Gives some criticism of the practice of building in areas where flooding is inevitable. Uses actual film footage shot during floods in Richmond, New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Graham Chase
results.description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. results.title: The Water miners
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Guy Ballantyne
results.brief_description: An examination of the large hydro-electric power scheme envisaged for the Gordon River system in Tasmania. Shows exploration of the area, building of roads and camps, and the work of all the hydrologists and engineers. The plan is to build dams in the steep gorges to catch water to turn the turbines.
results.description: An examination of the large hydro-electric power scheme envisaged for the Gordon River system in Tasmania. results.title: The Water famine
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System Television and Jack Beck
results.brief_description: The role of water in the birth and decay of civilization and the problems of man as he searches for new sources. The critical water shortage and the population explosion; the problems of pollution; desalinization demonstrated by the “flash freezing” process used in Israel and the electro-dialysis process used in the United States.

results.title: The Water dwellers
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Jim Jeffrey, Don Murray and John Hosking
results.brief_description:
A study of the people living and working in the Pittwater area 25 miles north of Sydney, New South Wales.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Water cycle. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, American Geological Institute and Bert Van Bork
results.brief_description:
Illustrates the constant exchange of moisture between air, land and sea. Evaporation, condensation, and the effects of the water cycle on the climate and land are closely examined.
Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: The Water cycle
results.brief_description: The movement of water is traced through its cycle of eternal change from ocean to sky and back again to the ocean. The relation between evaporation, condensation, saturation, and precipitation is explained. Animation is used to explain how the water table is formed, how water passes through plant bodies and returns to the atmosphere. Direct photography vividly shows the surface run-off from raindrop to ocean, and the function of vegetation and damming in controlling this run-off.
results.description: The movement of water is traced through its cycle of eternal change from ocean to sky and back again to the ocean. results.title: The Water cycle
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Ron Bowie and Philip McDonald
results.brief_description: Illustrates how water is artificially trapped for power generation as well as a water supply for domestic, rural and industrial purposes. Dangers of pollution are emphasised, particularly the discharge of raw sewage into rivers and the sea.

results.title: The Water Babies
results.brief_description: When Tom is unfairly blamed for stealing, he escapes by leaping into the water of Dead Man’s Pool. There he and his dog Toby become cartoons in an animated world of fantasy, adventure and songs, befriending the Water Babies and helping to save them from the dreaded Shark and Electric Eel. Starring James Mason, Joan Greenwood and David Tomlinson.

results.title: The Watchkeepers
results.creator_credit: Network Television, Antelope Films, Channel Four and John Selwyn Gilbert
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Spaceship Earth”.
Satellite technology combined with computer graphics can present an enormous range of information about Spaceship Earth and its inhabitants. This information can be climatic, demographic, geographic, religious, horticultural, agricultural and social. This program reviews the range of information accessible via these combined technologies and with the help of the NASA computer examines the first “living portrait” of the earth.

results.title: The Watchers
results.creator_credit: Steven McGregor, Joe Weatherstone, Cath Moore and AFTRS
results.brief_description: In a world where all our desires are monitored, a teenage boy is inspired to cross the line. But The Watchers are out and they show him where his actions may lead. Cast: Wayne Pygram, Dane Sheddon, Nathaniel Dean, Wayne Blair. 35mm live action footage with digital effects created on SGI, Mac and PC. Original format 35 mm/colour.
